game

Class Cavern

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Cavern

  • public class Cavern
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance is a Cavern through which the explorer can move. It's a grid of Tile objects with a weighted graph of all non-floor tiles. There is an entrance to the cavern and a target location (which may also be the entrance).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Cavern.Direction
      An enum representing a grid direction.

    • Method Detail

      • digExploreCavern

        public static Cavern digExploreCavern(int rows,
                                      int cols,
                                      java.util.Random rand)
        Return a new random cavern of the given size where there is no gold, all edges have weight 1, and there is an orb a reasonable distance from the exit.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in this cavern.
        cols - The number of columns in this cavern.
        rand - A source of randomness to use for the cavern generation.

      • digEscapeCavern

        public static Cavern digEscapeCavern(int rows,
                                     int cols,
                                     int currentRow,
                                     int currentCol,
                                     java.util.Random rand)
        Return a new random cavern with random gold and edge weights. It is guaranteed that (currentRow, currentCol) will be an open floor cell.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in this cavern.
        cols - The number of columns in this cavern.
        currentRow - The row of the cell that must be open floor.
        currentCol - The column of the cell that must be open floor.
        rand - A source of randomness to use for the cavern generation.

      • numOpenTiles

        public int numOpenTiles()
        Returns the number of open floor tiles in this cavern (this is the size of the graph).

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Return the number of rows in the grid.

      • getColumnCount

        public int getColumnCount()
        Return the number of columns in the grid.

      • getGraph

        public java.util.Set<Node> getGraph()
        Return the set of all nodes in the graph. This is an umodifiable view of the graph.

      • getEntrance

        public Node getEntrance()
        Return the node corresponding to the entrance to the cavern.

      • getTarget

        public Node getTarget()
        Return the target node in this cavern.

      • getTileAt

        public Tile getTileAt(int r,
                      int c)
        Return the Tile information for tile (r, c). Precondition: (r, c) must be in the grid.

      • getNodeAt

        public Node getNodeAt(int r,
                      int c)
        Return the node at the given (r, c). Precondition: (r, c) must be in the grid.

      • serialize

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> serialize()
        Serialize this cavern to a list of strings which can be written out to a file. The list of strings can be converted back into a Cavern using deserialize().

      • deserialize

        public static Cavern deserialize(java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodeStrList)
        Convert nodeStrList, which was output by serialize(), back into a Cavern. Precondition: The list of strings is of the format output by serialize().
